description.narrative: Awareness creation tool for WASH and landscape approach

DWA has identified five approaches that can lead to Environmental Sustainability of WASH interventions, as stated in the definition document of Environmental Sustainability component of the “FIETS” (provided):
1. Thinking with the landscape: understanding of water flows and community needs 2. 3R approach: Recharge, Retention and Re-use of water resources 3. 3R approach: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle of waste(flows) 4. Low cost, low maintenance and environmental friendly technologies 5. Ecosystem service approach: maintaining resources and services of natural environment upon which communities depend It was decided the CAT should mainly focus on: - Supporting planning processes in WASH towards more Environmental Sustainability (as defined by the Dutch WASH Alliance), - Supporting users of the DWDST to make informed decisions on water supply technology selection.

Develop a Catchment Assessment Tool that will support planning of WASH interventions at the earliest stage of a project in the context of and taking into account opportunities and risks of the surrounding landscape regarding environmentally sustainable approaches and facilitating to make informed decisions regarding this.

The aim is to create awareness amongst key actors of civil society, public and private sector on the linkage between WASH interventions and the ecosystem, who are then capable of balancing environmental and WASH development needs into their strategies and interventions.
